unnormalised: AI startup, 'InnovAI', based out of Bangalore, has secured $5M in Series A funding led by Sequoia Capital India, according to a press release dated 20/07/2024. The funding will be used to scale InnovAI’s development of its proprietary large language model (LLM), BharatGPT, specifically designed for the Indian vernacular language market. BharatGPT aims to provide AI-powered solutions in Hinglish and other regional languages, catering to a user base often underserved by existing global LLMs.
normalised: A-I startup, 'Innov-A-I', based out of Bangalore, has secured dollar five million in Series A funding led by Sequoia Capital India, according to a press release dated twentieth July two thousand and twenty four. The funding will be used to scale Innov-A-I’s development of its proprietary large language model (L-L-M), Bharat-G-P-T, specifically designed for the Indian vernacular language market. Bharat-G-P-T aims to provide A-I-powered solutions in Hinglish and other regional languages, catering to a user base often underserved by existing global L-L-M-s.

unnormalised: InnovAI CEO, Mr. Rajesh Kumar, stated, "This investment will allow us to rapidly expand our team and infrastructure to meet the growing demand for accessible AI solutions in India. We are committed to bridging the digital divide by making AI technologies more inclusive and user-friendly." The company plans to hire approximately 50 additional engineers and researchers over the next 6 months.
normalised: Innov-A-I C-E-O, Mister Rajesh Kumar, stated, "This investment will allow us to rapidly expand our team and infrastructure to meet the growing demand for accessible A-I solutions in India. We are committed to bridging the digital divide by making A-I technologies more inclusive and user-friendly." The company plans to hire approximately fifty additional engineers and researchers over the next six months.

unnormalised: BharatGPT's architecture incorporates 175 billion parameters and is trained on a massive dataset of Indian text and speech data, ensuring contextual accuracy and cultural relevance. The model currently supports Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Bengali, and Marathi, with plans to add additional languages in the near future. Initial applications include customer service chatbots, content creation tools, and educational resources.
normalised: Bharat-G-P-T's architecture incorporates one hundred and seventy five billion parameters and is trained on a massive dataset of Indian text and speech data, ensuring contextual accuracy and cultural relevance. The model currently supports Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Bengali, and Marathi, with plans to add additional languages in the near future. Initial applications include customer service chatbots, content creation tools, and educational resources.

unnormalised: Industry analysts predict a significant growth in the Indian AI market, estimating a value of $15 billion by 2026. This investment in InnovAI reflects the increasing interest in developing AI solutions tailored to the specific needs of the Indian market. The company's focus on vernacular languages positions it as a key player in this rapidly expanding sector.
normalised: Industry analysts predict a significant growth in the Indian A-I market, estimating a value of dollar fifteen billion by two thousand and twenty six. This investment in Innov-A-I reflects the increasing interest in developing A-I solutions tailored to the specific needs of the Indian market. The company's focus on vernacular languages positions it as a key player in this rapidly expanding sector.

unnormalised: InnovAI's BharatGPT faces competition from both global players and other Indian AI startups. However, its strong focus on cultural nuances and regional languages gives it a competitive advantage in the Indian market. The company is currently collaborating with several government agencies and educational institutions to deploy its AI solutions in areas such as healthcare and education.

unnormalised: The funding round also included participation from existing investors, Accel and Lightspeed Venture Partners. InnovAI previously raised $1M in seed funding in 2022. The company's valuation after the Series A round is estimated to be around $25 million.
